home.heroSubtitle: A Decentralized Justice Platform Built for the People
home.missionTitle: When the Courts Fall Silent, the Public Speaks
home.missionText: Every testimony, receipt, and record becomes part of a living case file that no one can silence. The Court of Public Record transforms scattered testimonies into verified, permanent case files through a transparent process ‚Äî built by victims, powered by evidence, and preserved by truth.
home.missionQuote: Truth isn't fragile. It just needs somewhere to live.

howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.subtitle: The Court of Public Record transforms scattered testimonies into verified, permanent case files through a transparent six-step process.
howItWorks.step1Subtitle: Every Case Starts with More than One Claim
howItWorks.step1Desc: The Court of Public Record requires at least two independent claims before opening a case. This protects against personal vendettas and ensures patterns of behavior are documented, not isolated grievances. Every accusation is reviewed for basic credibility before proceeding.
howItWorks.step2Desc: Once verified, a case is assigned a unique Case ID and given a permanent URL on the platform. The case becomes publicly accessible, allowing additional victims to come forward and add their testimony. All submissions are timestamped and attributed.
howItWorks.step3Desc: Victims, witnesses, and investigators collaboratively build a chronological timeline of events, interactions, and financial flows. Each entry is tagged with a date, location, and supporting evidence. The timeline reveals patterns that isolated victims could never see alone.
howItWorks.step4Desc: The compiled evidence is presented for public review. Community members can examine the timeline, read testimonies, and view supporting documents. The community can vote on the validity of specific claims, creating a transparent consensus.
howItWorks.step5Subtitle: Patterns Documented into a Formal Case File
howItWorks.step5Desc: Confirmed patterns of behavior are documented into a formal Case File. This includes the defendant profile, verified timeline, victim testimonies, and supporting evidence. The record becomes a comprehensive reference for anyone researching the individual.
howItWorks.step6Desc: The completed record is permanently preserved, ensuring the truth is accessible to future partners, employers, investors, or authorities. The Court of Public Record exists so that no one has to discover the truth the hard way ‚Äî alone.

wizard.title: File a New Case
wizard.caseFiledMessage: Your case has been filed. The public record is now open. This record is permanent ‚Äî no one can silence it.
wizard.step1Desc: Provide as much identifying information as possible. The more details you include, the easier it is for other victims to recognize them.
wizard.step2Desc: Establish how you know the accused and the nature of your relationship.
wizard.step3Desc: Every case involves a foundation of trust that was violated ‚Äî whether explicitly promised or simply expected.
wizard.step4Desc: State the facts of what happened. Dates, locations, people present, and exact actions are what make a case undeniable.
wizard.step5Desc: Build the chronological record. These events form the public timeline ‚Äî they reveal patterns.
wizard.step6Desc: Summarize the facts for the public record. Write it like a case abstract ‚Äî clear, factual, compelling.
wizard.step7Desc: Quantify what this cost you. Financial, physical, and personal.
wizard.step8Desc: Catalog what evidence you have. You can upload files after submission from your case dashboard.
wizard.step9Desc: Who else can verify your account? Other victims, eyewitnesses, or professionals with relevant expertise.
wizard.step10Desc: Document any steps taken through traditional legal channels.
wizard.step11Desc: Control who can see your identity. Your safety comes first.
wizard.step12Desc: Review your case file before it enters the permanent record.
wizard.fullNamePlaceholder: Leave blank to auto-generate from first + last
wizard.physicalDescPlaceholder: Describe their appearance, online handle, or the platform where you encountered them.
wizard.describeAccused: Describe the accused to someone who has never met them
wizard.describeAccusedPlaceholder: How they present themselves, distinguishing features, patterns of behavior. E.g., 'Presents as a successful investor. Well-dressed, confident. Targets single parents through community groups.'
wizard.step1Micro: Every detail helps. Aliases, old phone numbers, even a city ‚Äî anything that connects this person to their pattern.
wizard.relationshipPlaceholder: How do you know the accused?
wizard.firstInteraction: Describe your first interaction with the accused
wizard.firstInteractionPlaceholder: When and where did you first meet or make contact? What were the circumstances? Who introduced you?
wizard.earlyWarnings: In retrospect, were there any early warning signs or inconsistencies?
wizard.earlyWarningsPlaceholder: Things that seemed odd at the time, inconsistencies in their story, moments of discomfort you dismissed. These details help warn other potential victims.
wizard.step2Micro: Context matters. A jury needs to understand the dynamic between you and the accused.
wizard.explicitAgreement: Was there an explicit agreement, promise, or contract?
wizard.stateTerms: State the terms of the agreement
wizard.stateTermsPlaceholder: Include exact words, dates, and conditions. E.g., 'On June 3rd, he agreed in writing to complete the renovation by August 1st for $24,000.'
wizard.reasonableExpectation: What did you reasonably expect from this relationship or situation?
wizard.expectationPlaceholder: E.g., 'I expected to be safe in my own home,' 'I expected my employer to pay me,' 'I expected my doctor to follow medical standards,' 'This was an unprovoked act.'
wizard.evidenceOfTrust: What evidence supports this expectation or agreement?
wizard.evidenceOfTrustPlaceholder: Contracts, texts, emails, verbal agreements in front of witnesses, professional standards, or laws that were violated. List what you have.
wizard.othersVouch: Did anyone else encourage your trust in the accused?
wizard.othersVouchPlaceholder: Mutual friends who introduced you, reviews you read, credentials they showed, references they provided, institutions that endorsed them.
wizard.step3Micro: Trust is the mechanism. Establishing how it was built is how you prove it was exploited.
wizard.whatHappenedPlaceholder: Be specific. Instead of 'he stole from me,' write 'On March 15, he transferred $12,400 from our joint account to an account I'd never seen.' Dates, amounts, locations, and exact actions.
wizard.primaryIncident: Describe the most significant incident in detail
wizard.primaryIncidentPlaceholder: If there were multiple incidents, describe the one that best represents the pattern. Include the date, location, who was present, and exactly what occurred.
wizard.whenRealized: When did you first realize something was wrong?
wizard.whenRealizedPlaceholder: Was it sudden or gradual? What triggered the realization?
wizard.howConfirmed: How did you confirm what was happening?
wizard.howConfirmedPlaceholder: Did you find evidence? Did someone tell you? Did they confess? Did you catch them?
wizard.ongoingWarning: ‚ö† If you are in immediate danger, contact emergency services immediately.
wizard.step4Micro: Specificity is credibility. Every date, amount, and location strengthens your case.
wizard.timelineInstructions: Build the chronological record. These events become the public timeline ‚Äî they reveal patterns that isolated victims could never see alone.
wizard.step5Micro: A strong timeline has 5-10 events minimum. Include the small moments ‚Äî they often reveal the most.
wizard.oneLineSummary: In one sentence, what is this case about?
wizard.oneLinePlaceholder: E.g., 'A licensed contractor who took $38,000 to renovate my kitchen and disappeared' or 'A partner who systematically isolated me from my family over three years'
wizard.caseSummaryLabel: Write your case summary for the public record
wizard.caseSummaryPlaceholder: Summarize the facts of your case. Lead with who, what, when, and where. Include key evidence and describe the impact. This is what the jury and the public will read first.
wizard.promptWho: I first encountered [the accused] on [date] through [context]...
wizard.guidedPromptsTitle: Structure your summary around the facts:
wizard.summaryShort: Consider adding more detail. Specificity makes a case compelling.
wizard.step6Micro: This is your opening statement. Lead with facts. Let the evidence speak.
wizard.emotionalImpact: Describe any psychological or emotional effects
wizard.emotionalPlaceholder: Anxiety, depression, insomnia, inability to trust, impact on relationships, PTSD symptoms ‚Äî be specific about what changed.
wizard.physicalImpact: Describe any physical injuries or health effects
wizard.physicalPlaceholder: Injuries sustained, stress-related health problems, hospitalizations, changes in weight, sleep, or substance use.
wizard.wishUnderstood: What do you wish people understood about what happened to you? (optional)
wizard.wishUnderstoodPlaceholder: The thing that friends, family, or the public doesn't see or understand.
wizard.step7Micro: Every dollar documented strengthens your claim. If you're not sure of the exact amount, estimate conservatively.
wizard.evidenceChecklistTitle: What evidence do you have? (check all that apply)
wizard.step8Micro: You don't need all of these. Even a single screenshot or bank statement can be the difference between an allegation and a proven case.
wizard.witnessInstructions: Every corroborating voice strengthens your case. Even someone who only witnessed part of what happened matters.
wizard.witTypeCharacter: Character ‚Äî can speak to the accused's pattern of behavior
wizard.witTypeCorroborating: Corroborating ‚Äî has a similar experience with the same accused
wizard.witTypeExpert: Expert ‚Äî has professional expertise relevant to the case
wizard.witTypeDigital: Digital ‚Äî was present in online interactions or group chats
wizard.witnessCanVerifyPlaceholder: Specifically, what did they see, hear, or experience?
wizard.step9Micro: Every corroborating voice strengthens your case.
wizard.legalPlaceholder: Case numbers, police report numbers, court outcomes, pending actions...
wizard.whyFiling: Why are you filing on the Court of Public Record?
wizard.whyFilingPlaceholder: The legal system failed me because... / I want to warn others because... / I'm filing here in addition to legal action because...
wizard.otherVictims: Are you aware of other victims of the accused?
wizard.step10Micro: Filing here doesn't replace legal action ‚Äî it supplements it. Your record is permanent regardless of what happens in court.
wizard.visOpen: üü¢ Open ‚Äî I will stand behind this publicly with my full identity
wizard.visShielded: üü° Shielded ‚Äî Show my display name, protect my legal identity
wizard.visProtected: üü† Protected ‚Äî Verify me privately, show me as anonymous to the public
wizard.visProxy: üî¥ Proxy ‚Äî Filed by my attorney or advocate on my behalf
wizard.accusedAware: Is the accused aware you are filing this?
wizard.currentContact: Are you currently in contact with the accused?
wizard.consentRealName: I consent to my real name being associated with this case
wizard.consentContact: I consent to my contact information being shared with case investigators
wizard.consentTerms: I agree to the terms of service and understand this record is permanent
wizard.deadManDesc: You can configure a safety switch from your profile after filing. If you stop checking in, designated contacts will be notified.
wizard.nominalDamagesPlaceholder: Amount You Are Claiming in Damages
wizard.nominalDamagesNote: This is the amount you believe you are owed. Jury members will vote on whether to award this amount.
wizard.mustAcceptTerms: You must accept the terms of service before submitting.
wizard.descriptionPlaceholder: Describe their appearance, online handle, or the platform where you encountered them.
wizard.businessNamePlaceholder: Full legal name of the business
wizard.explicitAgreementPlaceholder: Was there an explicit written or verbal agreement? A contract? A promise? Describe the terms or select 'Not applicable' if this was a violation without any prior agreement.
wizard.agreementTerms: State the terms of the agreement
wizard.agreementTermsPlaceholder: Include exact words, dates, and conditions. E.g., 'On June 3rd, he agreed in writing to complete the renovation by August 1st for $24,000.'
wizard.reasonableExpectationPlaceholder: E.g., 'I expected to be safe in my own home,' 'I expected my employer to pay me,' 'I expected my doctor to follow medical standards.'
wizard.oneLineSummaryPlaceholder: E.g., 'A licensed contractor who took $38,000 to renovate my kitchen and disappeared'
wizard.caseSummaryPlaceholder: Summarize the facts of your case. Lead with who, what, when, and where. Include key evidence and describe the impact.
wizard.evidenceChecklistDesc: Check all evidence types you currently have access to. You can upload files after submission.
wizard.forcedContact: Forced contact (e.g. shared custody, same workplace)
